summary:
A curious and creative individual with a passion for making a positive impact on the world. Fluent in English, Spanish, and Swedish, and with conversational proficiency in Italian, Dutch, and Danish. My international experiences, having lived in 7 different countries, have given me a unique perspective on cultural diversity and cross-cultural understanding. My background in music, art, design, writing and management allows me to approach challenges with a creative mindset. 

I am particularly interested in products and services that promote environmental & financial sustainability. Such as the Sabi Lamp, a solar-powered fishing lamp in Lake Victoria that increases incomes, reduces pollution, and feeds friends all at once. Or like with Carbon Credits at Agreena, promoting regenerative agriculture, locking CO2 into healthier soils, all whilst paying farmers.

Currently based in Copenhagen, always eager to explore new opportunities and experiences.

projects: [{'title': 'Sagar & The Sabi Lamp', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': 'Tasked with aiding in the expanse of solar-powered fishing lamps for fishermen across Lake Victoria. Increasing incomes, reducing pollution, & feeding friends all in one ;)', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sebastian', 'last_name': 'Alm', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative Director at Alto Alm'}]}, {'title': 'SILC Uganda', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'My project team and I are facilitating knowledge exchange between Dutch agriculture teachers at Zone College in The Netherlands and Ugandan agriculture teachers at Hoys College in Bukomansimbi, Uganda within the SILC (Sustainable International Learning Community) concept. The SILC concept bases collaboration on the SDGs, global citizenship and connections between The Netherlands, Uganda, & Romania.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sebastian', 'last_name': 'Alm', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative Director at Alto Alm'}]}, {'title': 'Value Creators - Lets Talk Immigration', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'My project team and I dove into the complex topic of refugee immigration to the Netherlands. We conducted extensive research and did multiple interviews with refugees in the Netherlands where we conducted an awareness campaign on social media on the topic of refugee immigration aimed for the Dutch national elections in March 2021 (Link below).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sebastian', 'last_name': 'Alm', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative Director at Alto Alm'}]}, {'title': 'Sustainable Democracy', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'My team and I looked at the topics of Democratic Participation and Democratic Representation within the realm of Democratic Ownership as requested by our client Ferenc van Damme, a policy developer at the department of Participation & Communication at the provincial government of Overijssel. Through extensive desk research and interviews with stakeholders, our team delivered an Advisory Report to our client.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sebastian', 'last_name': 'Alm', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative Director at Alto Alm'}]}, {'title': 'Climate Adaptation Project', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'My team and I were tasked with giving advice to the municipality of Zwolle, Overijssel on Climate Adaptation. We did extensive secondary research and interviewed stakeholders (such as Architects, Municipality Officials, and Local Residents). We delivered an advisory report with our advice and ideas on how to help the city on issues such as heat islands, flooding, and noise pollution to name a few. \n\nI came up with the idea of capturing rainwater (which The Netherlands has a lot of) through transforming the roofs of the buildings that were next to the train tracks into green roofs and having a bit of the captured rainwater be released from the side of the building facing the train tracks like a waterfall whenever a train went by in order to reduce noise pollution. They thought it was a "creative" idea haha.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sebastian', 'last_name': 'Alm', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative Director at Alto Alm'}]}]
